page.title: 05VINTAGE TRACTORS IN SHAWHEAD
page.content:
We went to see Mr Harvey's farm. We saw the Case LA which is an American tractor and it was made in 1942. It runs on petrol and paraffin and it uses 40 gallons a day. It used to belong to a man in Carlisle but Mr Harvey bought it for a lot of money (Â£650). It can only go at 14mph. It has got no cab and you have to start it by hand.
Then we saw another tractor. It is called a Field Marshall. It is a British tractor and it was bought for Â£1200 in 1950. Then Mr Harvey bought it. It can pull 16 tons and it can pull a caravan and other things. It uses 3 gallons of diesel in a day. It has got 8 forward and 2 reverse gears and it can go at 9mph. It has a handle start and poor brake. You start it with paper soaked in saltpetre.
